ECMO has been used successfully to manage patients with severe respiratory failure in previous coronavirus epidemics.
55 Data from the Middle East respiratory syndrome epidemic demonstrated improved survival in patients with severe ARDS supported by venovenous ECMO.
56 A meta-analysis of patients with isolated viral myocarditis, supported by venoarterial (VA)-ECMO, found a similar survival benefit in this group.
57 As a result, elective ECMO cannulation reportedly has been used worldwide to support COVID-19 patients. 58, 59, 60 In these reports, ECMO was used to provide cardiopulmonary support and preserve end-organ function while allowing for the administration of antiviral and anti-inflammatory therapies.
